column1: '''Indo''' is a [[Quenya]] word for "the mind (in its purposing faculty) or will"<ref>{{VT
More specifically, ''Indo'' has several meanings concerning the mind or the mood: "inner heart, mood", "state (of mind)"<ref>{{VT
column2: 39b}}, p. 23</ref>, "mind, region/range of thought" "inner thought, in [[fea]] as exhibited in character"<ref>[[Parma Eldalamberon 17]] pp.155, 179, 189</ref>, "resolve, will"<ref>{{VT

column3: LR}}, [[The Etymologies]] p. 361</ref>, perhaps the [[Primitive Quendian]] form was *''idnô''
